title: Consumer Price Index of all urban consumers , by region 2019
summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Country, and Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) in each Country on the y axis.
The maximum Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) 270.35 is found at Country West and the minimum is found at Midwest where Country is 237.78.
The highest Country West has 32.57 more Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) than the lowest Country Midwest.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Country in the x axis and Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) in the y axis.
Country West has the highest Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) and Midwest has the lowest Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984).

max_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) for 5 number of Countrys.
The Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) is appeared to be the highest at Country West and lowest at Country Midwest.
The minimum Country Midwest has got 1.14 times less Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) than the maximum Country West.
Country West is higher than any other Countrys with value 270.35, followed by , and U.S. city average. Down to Country Midwest with the lowest value 237.78.
The lowest value 237.78 at Midwest is almost 1.06 times smaller than the average value 255.89.
Summing up the values of all Countrys, we get total 1279.45.
